entry.title: Smoke Outlook for September 2 & 3 , 2017
entry.summary: Smoke: Somewhat better air quality will continue across the area today with daytime west winds, becoming calmer overnight, allowing smoke to settle back down into valleys by early morning. Increased fire activity due to higher winds, especially on Sunday, will produce more smoke overall. Fire: Dry and breezy conditions today will lead to critical fire weather conditions in some areas today, higher winds on Sunday will lead to more widespread critical fire weather conditions. Fire activity will be influence by these winds, which will strongest at higher elevations. Other: Winds will increase, strongest at higher elevations, today and tomorrow with even drier air moving into the region tonight. The next change in the weather is Monday and Tuesday when cooler weather and east winds are possible. If you live within Missoula County, please refer to the Missoula City-County Health Department for detailed smoke response information (see link below). ...
entry.content:
Smoke Outlook for September 2 & 3 , 2017

Incident: Sunrise Fire Wildfire
Released: 4 hrs. ago

Smoke: Somewhat better air quality will continue across the area today with daytime west winds, becoming calmer overnight, allowing smoke to settle back down into valleys by early morning. Increased fire activity due to higher winds, especially on Sunday, will produce more smoke overall.

Fire: Dry and breezy conditions today will lead to critical fire weather conditions in some areas today, higher winds on Sunday will lead to more widespread critical fire weather conditions. Fire activity will be influence by these winds, which will strongest at higher elevations.

Other: Winds will increase, strongest at higher elevations, today and tomorrow with even drier air moving into the region tonight. The next change in the weather is Monday and Tuesday when cooler weather and east winds are possible. If you live within Missoula County, please refer to the Missoula City-County Health Department for detailed smoke response information (see link below).

http://wildlandfiresmoke.net/outlooks/2017/Montana#N

entry.content:
Smoke Outlook for September 2, 2017

Incident: Burdette Fire Wildfire
Released: 4 hrs. ago

Smoke: Somewhat better air quality will continue across the area today with daytime west winds, becoming calmer overnight, allowing smoke to settle back down into valleys by early morning. Increased fire activity due to higher winds, especially on Sunday, will produce more smoke overall.

Fire: Dry and breezy conditions today will lead to critical fire weather conditions in some areas today, higher winds on Sunday will lead to more widespread critical fire weather conditions. Fire activity will be influence by these winds, which will strongest at higher elevations.

Other: Winds will increase, strongest at higher elevations, today and tomorrow with even drier air moving into the region tonight. The next change in the weather is Monday and Tuesday when cooler weather and east winds are possible. If you live within Missoula County, please refer to the Missoula City-County Health Department for detailed smoke response information (see link below).

http://wildlandfiresmoke.net/outlooks/2017/Montana#N

entry.title: Smoke Outlook for September 1 2017
entry.summary: Smoke: Overall Friday is best represented by “Good” to “Moderate” for air quality. Smoke is expected to filter back into valley locations overnight. Air quality for the weekend is expected to degrade. Fire: The Sunrise fire is located 11 miles SE of Superior, MT adjacent to I-90. Southwest portion of the fire continues to back and flank. Minimal fire growth has been observed and an increase in acreage is not expected on the Sunrise fire. Other: Slightly cooler temperatures Friday accompanied by breezy west winds on the ridgetops. A strong ridge of high pressure will re-establish itself across the Western United States through the upcoming weekend brining record high temperatures and continued dry conditions. Fires with active perimeters should expect an increase in fire behavior. Air quality has improved across the forecast area and is expected to remain in the “Good” range for Superior and Alberton. Frenchtown and Missoula’s air quality will be best represented by...
entry.content:
Smoke Outlook for September 1 2017

Incident: Sunrise Fire Wildfire
Released: 1 day ago

Smoke: Overall Friday is best represented by “Good” to “Moderate” for air quality. Smoke is expected to filter back into valley locations overnight. Air quality for the weekend is expected to degrade.

Fire: The Sunrise fire is located 11 miles SE of Superior, MT adjacent to I-90. Southwest portion of the fire continues to back and flank. Minimal fire growth has been observed and an increase in acreage is not expected on the Sunrise fire.

Other: Slightly cooler temperatures Friday accompanied by breezy west winds on the ridgetops. A strong ridge of high pressure will re-establish itself across the Western United States through the upcoming weekend brining record high temperatures and continued dry conditions. Fires with active perimeters should expect an increase in fire behavior. Air quality has improved across the forecast area and is expected to remain in the “Good” range for Superior and Alberton. Frenchtown and Missoula’s air quality will be best represented by “Moderate”, and Missoula may experience “USG” overnight. If you live within Missoula County, please refer to the Missoula CityCounty Health Department for detailed smoke health information (see link below).

Additional Links
DEQ Today's Air
Missoula County Air Quality Updates

Inciweb Sunrise http://wildlandfiresmoke.net/outlooks/2017/Montana#Area2

entry.content:
Smoke Outlook for September 1 2017

Incident: Burdette Fire Wildfire
Released: 1 day ago

Smoke: Overall Friday is best represented by “Good” to “Moderate” for air quality. Smoke is expected to filter back into valley locations overnight. Air quality for the weekend is expected to degrade.

Fire: The Sunrise fire is located 11 miles SE of Superior, MT adjacent to I-90. Southwest portion of the fire continues to back and flank. Minimal fire growth has been observed and an increase in acreage is not expected on the Sunrise fire.

Other: Slightly cooler temperatures Friday accompanied by breezy west winds on the ridgetops. A strong ridge of high pressure will re-establish itself across the Western United States through the upcoming weekend brining record high temperatures and continued dry conditions. Fires with active perimeters should expect an increase in fire behavior. Air quality has improved across the forecast area and is expected to remain in the “Good” range for Superior and Alberton. Frenchtown and Missoula’s air quality will be best represented by “Moderate”, and Missoula may experience “USG” overnight. If you live within Missoula County, please refer to the Missoula CityCounty Health Department for detailed smoke health information (see link below).
